text: I humbly thank you, sir.

text: Dost know this waterfly?

text: No, my good lord.

text: Thy state is the more gracious,

text: for ’tis a vice to know him. He hath much

text: land, and fertile. Let a beast be lord of beasts and his

speaker: HAMLET
text: crib shall stand at the king’s mess. ’Tis a chough,

speaker: HAMLET
text: but, as I say, spacious in the possession of dirt.

speaker: OSRIC
text: Sweet lord, if your Lordship were at leisure, I

speaker: OSRIC
text: should impart a thing to you from his Majesty.

speaker: HAMLET
text: I will receive it, sir, with all diligence of

speaker: HAMLET
text: spirit. Put your bonnet to his right use: ’tis for the

speaker: HAMLET
text: head.

speaker: OSRIC
text: I thank your Lordship; it is very hot.

speaker: HAMLET
text: No, believe me, ’tis very cold; the wind is

speaker: HAMLET
text: northerly.

speaker: OSRIC
text: It is indifferent cold, my lord, indeed.

speaker: HAMLET
text: But yet methinks it is very sultry and hot for

speaker: HAMLET
text: my complexion.

speaker: OSRIC
text: Exceedingly, my lord; it is very sultry, as

speaker: OSRIC
text: ’twere—I cannot tell how. My lord, his Majesty

speaker: OSRIC
text: bade me signify to you that he has laid a great wager

speaker: OSRIC
text: on your head. Sir, this is the matter—

speaker: HAMLET
text: I beseech you, remember.

speaker: OSRIC
text: Nay, good my lord, for my ease, in good faith.

speaker: OSRIC
text: Sir, here is newly come to court Laertes—believe

speaker: OSRIC
text: me, an absolute gentleman, full of most excellent

speaker: OSRIC
text: differences, of very soft society and great showing.

speaker: OSRIC
text: Indeed, to speak feelingly of him, he is the card or

speaker: OSRIC
text: calendar of gentry, for you shall find in him the

speaker: OSRIC
text: continent of what part a gentleman would see.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Sir, his definement suffers no perdition in

speaker: HAMLET
text: you, though I know to divide him inventorially

speaker: HAMLET
text: would dozy th’ arithmetic of memory, and yet but

speaker: HAMLET
text: yaw neither, in respect of his quick sail. But, in the

speaker: HAMLET
text: verity of extolment, I take him to be a soul of great

speaker: HAMLET
text: article, and his infusion of such dearth and rareness

speaker: HAMLET
text: as, to make true diction of him, his semblable is his

speaker: HAMLET
text: mirror, and who else would trace him, his umbrage,

speaker: HAMLET
text: nothing more.

speaker: OSRIC
text: Your Lordship speaks most infallibly of him.

text: The concernancy, sir? Why do we wrap the

text: gentleman in our more rawer breath?

speaker: OSRIC
text: Sir?

text: Is ’t not possible to understand in another

speaker: HORATIO
text: tongue? You will to ’t, sir, really.

text: What imports the nomination of

text: this gentleman?

text: Of Laertes?

text: His purse is empty already; all ’s golden words

text: are spent.

speaker: HAMLET
text: Of him, sir.

speaker: OSRIC
text: I know you are not ignorant—

text: I would you did, sir. Yet, in faith, if you did, it

speaker: HAMLET
text: would not much approve me. Well, sir?

text: You are not ignorant of what excellence Laertes

text: is—

speaker: HAMLET
text: I dare not confess that, lest I should compare

speaker: HAMLET
text: with him in excellence. But to know a man well

speaker: HAMLET
text: were to know himself.

speaker: OSRIC
text: I mean, sir, for his weapon. But in the imputation

speaker: OSRIC
text: laid on him by them, in his meed he’s

speaker: OSRIC
text: unfellowed.

text: What’s his weapon?

speaker: OSRIC
text: Rapier and dagger.

speaker: HAMLET
text: That’s two of his weapons. But, well—

speaker: OSRIC
text: The King, sir, hath wagered with him six Barbary

speaker: OSRIC
text: horses, against the which he has impawned, as I

speaker: OSRIC
text: take it, six French rapiers and poniards, with their

speaker: OSRIC
text: assigns, as girdle, hangers, and so. Three of the

speaker: OSRIC
text: carriages, in faith, are very dear to fancy, very

speaker: OSRIC
text: responsive to the hilts, most delicate carriages, and

speaker: OSRIC
text: of very liberal conceit.

text: What call you the “carriages”?

text: I knew you must be edified by the margent

speaker: HORATIO
text: ere you had done.

speaker: OSRIC
text: The carriages, sir, are the hangers.

speaker: HAMLET
text: The phrase would be more germane to the

speaker: HAMLET
text: matter if we could carry a cannon by our sides. I

speaker: HAMLET
text: would it might be “hangers” till then. But on. Six

speaker: HAMLET
text: Barbary horses against six French swords, their

speaker: HAMLET
text: assigns, and three liberal-conceited carriages—

speaker: HAMLET
text: that’s the French bet against the Danish. Why is this

speaker: HAMLET
text: all “impawned,” as you call it?

speaker: OSRIC
text: The King, sir, hath laid, sir, that in a dozen

speaker: OSRIC
text: passes between yourself and him, he shall not

speaker: OSRIC
text: exceed you three hits. He hath laid on twelve for

speaker: OSRIC
text: nine, and it would come to immediate trial if your

speaker: OSRIC
text: Lordship would vouchsafe the answer.

speaker: HAMLET
text: How if I answer no?

speaker: OSRIC
text: I mean, my lord, the opposition of your person

speaker: OSRIC
text: in trial.

text: Sir, I will walk here in the hall. If it please his

speaker: HAMLET
text: Majesty, it is the breathing time of day with me. Let

speaker: HAMLET
text: the foils be brought, the gentleman willing, and the

speaker: HAMLET
text: King hold his purpose, I will win for him, an I can.

speaker: HAMLET
text: If not, I will gain nothing but my shame and the odd

speaker: HAMLET
text: hits.

speaker: OSRIC
text: Shall I deliver you e’en so?

speaker: HAMLET
text: To this effect, sir, after what flourish your

speaker: HAMLET
text: nature will.

text: I commend my duty to your Lordship.

text:
Yours.

                .

text: it himself. There are no tongues else for ’s

speaker: HAMLET
text: turn.

text: This lapwing runs away with the shell on his

speaker: HORATIO
text: head.

speaker: HAMLET
text: He did comply, sir, with his dug before he

speaker: HAMLET
text: sucked it. Thus has he (and many more of the same

speaker: HAMLET
text: breed that I know the drossy age dotes on) only got

speaker: HAMLET
text: the tune of the time, and, out of an habit of

speaker: HAMLET
text: encounter, a kind of yeasty collection, which carries

speaker: HAMLET
text: them through and through the most fanned

speaker: HAMLET
text: and winnowed opinions; and do but blow them to

speaker: HAMLET
text: their trial, the bubbles are out.

speaker: LORD
text: My lord, his Majesty commended him to you by

speaker: LORD
text: young Osric, who brings back to him that you

speaker: LORD
text: attend him in the hall. He sends to know if your

speaker: LORD
text: pleasure hold to play with Laertes, or that you will

speaker: LORD
text: take longer time.

speaker: HAMLET
text: I am constant to my purposes. They follow

speaker: HAMLET
text: the King’s pleasure. If his fitness speaks, mine is

speaker: HAMLET
text: ready now or whensoever, provided I be so able as

speaker: HAMLET
text: now.

speaker: LORD
text: The King and Queen and all are coming down.

speaker: HAMLET
text: In happy time.

speaker: LORD
text: The Queen desires you to use some gentle

speaker: LORD
text: entertainment to Laertes before you fall to play.

speaker: HAMLET
text: She well instructs me.

speaker: HORATIO
text: You will lose, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text: I do not think so. Since he went into France, I

speaker: HAMLET
text: have been in continual practice. I shall win at the

speaker: HAMLET
